PRLTAO FT</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">White, C.G.; Lederman, L.M.; Jenkins, C.M.; Dukes, E.C.; James, C.; Kaplan, D.M.; Clark, K.; Ho, C.; Chen, Y.C.; Gidal, G.; Huang, M.; Gu, P.; Felix, J.; Chan, A.; Choong, W.S.; Leros, N.; Burnstein, R.A.; Durandet, C.; Chakravorty, A.; Holmstrom, T.; Gustafson, H.R.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="506" ind1=" " ind2="0"><subfield code="a">Free-to-read</subfield><subfield code="f">Unrestricted online access</subfield><subfield code="2">star</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="520" ind1="3" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">A sensitive search for the rare decays Ω⁻ → Λπ⁻ and Ξ° → pπ⁻ has been performed using data from the 1997 run of the HyperCP (Fermilab E871) experiment. Limits on other such processes do not exclude the possibility of observable rates for </subfield><subfield code=" ">= 2 nonleptonic hyperon decays, provided the decays occur through parity-odd operators. They obtain the branching-fraction limits Β(Ω⁻ → Λπ⁻) < 2.9 x 10⁻⁶ and Β(Ξ° → pπ⁻) < 8.2 x 10⁻⁶, both at 90% confidence level.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="536" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield Oak Ridge, Tenn. : Distributed by the Office of Scientific and Technical Information, U.S. Dept. of Energy. 4 pages : digital, PDF file. text txt rdacontent computer c rdamedia online resource cr rdacarrier Published through SciTech Connect. 03/01/2005. "fermilab-pub-05-067-e" "arXiv eprint number hep-ex/0503036" Physical Review Letters 94 ISSN 0031-9007; PRLTAO FT White, C.G.; Lederman, L.M.; Jenkins, C.M.; Dukes, E.C.; James, C.; Kaplan, D.M.; Clark, K.; Ho, C.; Chen, Y.C.; Gidal, G.; Huang, M.; Gu, P.; Felix, J.; Chan, A.; Choong, W.S.; Leros, N.; Burnstein, R.A.; Durandet, C.; Chakravorty, A.; Holmstrom, T.; Gustafson, H.R. Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star A sensitive search for the rare decays Ω⁻ → Λπ⁻ and Ξ° → pπ⁻ has been performed using data from the 1997 run of the HyperCP (Fermilab E871) experiment. Limits on other such processes do not exclude the possibility of observable rates for  = 2 nonleptonic hyperon decays, provided the decays occur through parity-odd operators. They obtain the branching-fraction limits Β(Ω⁻ → Λπ⁻) < 2.9 x 10⁻⁶ and Β(Ξ° → pπ⁻) < 8.2 x 10⁻⁶, both at 90% confidence level.
